Fees: $8,562/Year (CA Resident); Non-residents pay an additional $420 per unit
Description: The Master of Science in Civil Engineering (MSCE) is a 31-unit program designed to provide students with the technical skills required for a career in civil engineering practice or for advanced studies leading to a Ph.D. The MSCE program has the following areas of emphasis (options): Structural Engineering, Geotechnical Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Water Resources Engineering, and Transportation Engineering. The MSCE program is also available through the College of Professional and International Education (CPIE).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Computer Science
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. This can be demonstrated by submitting one of the following test scores: TOEFL minimum score of 80 iBT, IELTS minimum score of 6.0 overall band, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic minimum score of 53, or Duolingo English Test minimum score of 105. Proof of ELS Level 112 completion from an ELS Language Center is also accepted.
Description: The Master of Science in Computer Science (MSCS) is a rigorous program that provides students with a broad foundation in computer science, and an in-depth specialization in an area of their interest. The program balances theory and practice to prepare students for a successful career as a computer scientist in industry or to pursue a Ph.D. degree.
CostPerCredit: $270 per unit (College of Engineering Professional Program Fee) on top of basic tuition. Non-residents pay an additional $420 per unit.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Construction Management
EnglishScore: International applicants who do not possess a bachelor's degree from a U.S. post-secondary institution must submit a minimum score of 80 on the TOEFL iBT, or 550 on the TOEFL PBT, or an overall band score of 6.0 on the IELTS.
Requirements: To be considered for admission into the M.S. in Construction Management program, applicants must meet the general university requirements for admission to graduate studies. In addition, applicants must possess: A bachelor’s degree in a construction-related discipline (e.g., engineering, architecture, construction management, business, finance, etc.) with a minimum GPA of 2.7. Applicants with less than a 2.7 GPA may be admitted on a conditional basis. To apply to the program, students need to submit the following documents: University application, Official transcripts, Two letters of recommendation, A statement of purpose, A resume.
Description: The Master of Science in Construction Management (MSCM) degree is a practice-oriented, advanced graduate degree that provides a mixture of construction management and business-related courses. This program is designed for professionals with work experience in the construction industry and students with an undergraduate degree in construction management, construction engineering, civil engineering, architecture or business. The program’s mission is to provide an advanced construction management education that prepares students for careers as industry leaders.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Electrical Engineering
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English.
Concentration: ['Biomedical Engineering', 'Communications and Signal Processing', 'Control Systems', 'Digital and Computer Systems', 'Electronics and Solid-State Devices', 'Power Systems']
Description: The Master of Science in Electrical Engineering (MSEE) is a 30-unit program designed for both full- and part-time students. Graduate courses are offered primarily in the evenings to accommodate working professionals. The program offers a broad-based curriculum, which may be customized to meet individual needs with faculty advisor consultation. MSEE students develop a coherent program of study with the help of a graduate advisor. Options include a traditional thesis track and a non-thesis track featuring a final comprehensive exam. Courses cover theoretical, experimental, and design concepts, while encouraging research and creative problem-solving skills to prepare graduates for leadership positions.
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit for non-residents

ProgramName: Master of Science in Engineering (Interdisciplinary)
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting scores from one of the following tests: TOEFL (minimum 80 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.0 overall), PTE (minimum 53), Duolingo (minimum 105), or successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Description: The Master of Science in Engineering (MSE) is a unique, innovative, interdisciplinary, and professionally-focused engineering master's degree program developed in partnership with the local industry and offered by the College of Engineering (COE). It is a program to educate engineering and computer science professionals for leadership roles in industry, research, and public service. The program builds depth in a student-chosen engineering specialization area and complements it with breadth in systems engineering, and engineering management and leadership. The program provides the opportunity for students to choose engineering and computer science courses across different departments within the college of engineering, and it culminates in a one-year, two-semester, industry-sponsored capstone project. Students learn from world-class faculty experts, industry leaders and senior management professionals.
CostPerCredit: $396 per unit for non-residents (in addition to basic tuition and fees)

ProgramName: Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting a satisfactory score on one of the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo English Test.
Description: The Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering (MSME) program provides students with an opportunity to receive advanced instruction and to perform independent research in a variety of areas of specialization. The degree is awarded upon the satisfactory completion of a coherent program of study that includes a minimum of 30 units of graduate and upper-division coursework. The department requires that at least 21 of these units be in the 500/600 series in mechanical engineering courses. The remaining units must be approved by the student’s faculty advisor. Students have the option of pursuing a thesis (6 units of MAE 698) or a comprehensive exam (1 unit of MAE 697 and a 3-unit MAE elective). The MSME program is designed to develop a professional engineer with advanced abilities to solve complex problems in mechanical engineering. Emphasis is placed on the development of independent judgment, a creative approach to engineering problems, and the utilization of modern and advanced computational methods.
CostPerCredit: $396 per unit for non-residents (in addition to basic tuition and fees)

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Art with option in Art History
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. This can be met by submitting one of the following: TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 iBT (or 550 PBT); IELTS with a minimum overall band score of 6.0; Pearson Test of English (PTE) with a minimum score of 53; Duolingo English Test (DET) with a minimum score of 105; or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Department: College of the Arts, School of Art
Description: The Master of Arts degree program in Art with an option in Art History prepares students for careers in art history and for further study at the doctoral level. Graduate students in the Art History program work closely with a faculty of specialists who hold Ph.D.s in a wide range of fields, including contemporary art, modern art, early modern art, medieval art, Roman art, and the arts of Asia. The M.A. program curriculum is designed to provide a strong foundation in art historical method and research practices as well as flexibility in the choice of specialized topics. Students in the program take a series of seminars on critical theory and methodology and pursue their own specialized research interests in a series of further seminars and independent study courses, culminating in a Master’s Thesis on a topic of their choice. Many of our students present their research at professional conferences and in scholarly publications, and have gone on to doctoral study at R1 research universities, as well as to careers in museums, galleries, and other arts institutions and businesses. The Art History program is part of the CSULB School of Art, which is the largest and one of the most comprehensive public university art schools in the United States.
Accredidation: The School of Art at California State University, Long Beach is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Art with option in Art Education
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting one of the following test scores: TOEFL 80 iBT (or 550 PBT), IELTS 6.0 overall band score, PTE 53, or Duolingo English Test (DET) 110.
Description: The Master of Arts in Art with an option in Art Education is designed to serve the needs of a variety of professionals including elementary and secondary school art teachers, community college instructors, museum educators, and arts administrators. This advanced degree program provides students with opportunities to extend their professional knowledge of theory and practice. The curriculum requires candidates to conduct scholarly inquiry into the historical, philosophical, and theoretical foundations of art education.
Accredidation: The School of Art is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit (for non-residents, in addition to base tuition)

ProgramName: Master of Fine Arts in International Studio Arts
EnglishScore: All applicants, regardless of citizenship, who have not attended a post-secondary institution for at least three (3) years of full-time study where English is the official language of instruction, are required to submit official scores from one of the following exams: TOEFL iBT (minimum 80), IELTS Academic (minimum 6.0), PTE Academic (minimum 53), or Duolingo English Test (minimum 105).
Requirements:
Application to the School of Art is a two-part process. You must complete both steps to be considered for admission.
Step 1: Complete the university application on Cal State Apply.
Step 2: Complete the School of Art MFA Program Application on Slideroom which includes: Statement of Purpose (500-1000 words), Letters of Recommendation (3) submitted through Slideroom by the recommenders, Transcripts (unofficial), Portfolio of 20 images of your strongest, most recent work that demonstrates your readiness for graduate study in art, and an Image list (including title, medium, date, and dimensions for each piece).

Prerequisites:
Hold a baccalaureate degree in Art from an accredited institution, or a baccalaureate degree with a minimum of 24 upper-division units in Art, equivalent to the CSULB BFA degree in Studio Art.
Submit a portfolio of artwork that demonstrates a potential for success in the program.
Have a minimum of 2.75 GPA in the last 60 units of undergraduate coursework and a 3.0 GPA in all upper-division Art courses.
Description: The MFA in Art with a Concentration in Studio Art is a three-year program that prepares students to be professional artists. We are a research-focused program, which means students spend their time in the studio making work. The program supports the development of an individual practice in the context of a diverse community of artists. Our students gain expertise in their chosen media area, along with a broad understanding of contemporary art, theory, and professional practices. We emphasize the creative process as a form of research.
Accredidation: The School of Art is accredited by the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit (for non-residents, in addition to basic tuition)

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Dance
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. This can be met by submitting one of the following: TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 (Internet-based), IELTS with an overall band score of 6.0, PTE with a minimum score of 53, Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105, or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 grade-point average in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units of undergraduate coursework and a Bachelor’s degree with a major in dance from an accredited institution (a Bachelor’s degree with a minor in dance and substantial professional experience is also acceptable). In addition to the university application, a Department Application must be submitted which includes: a 500-word Statement of Purpose, a formal research paper of 8 to 12 pages, a current resume or curriculum vitae, three letters of recommendation, and a video audition.
Description: The Master of Arts degree in Dance is a 36-unit program that offers a broad, comprehensive and individualized course of study for students who hold a bachelor’s degree in dance, or its equivalent. The MA program prepares students for continued study in dance at the doctoral level, professional careers in dance education in the private sector or at the community college level, and/or related fields. The program is designed to develop students’ artistic and academic potential through advanced study in creative and scholarly work. MA students may complete their culminating experience with a written thesis or a creative project.
Accredidation: The Department of Dance is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Dance (NASD).
ScholarshipAmount: Amounts vary, with several departmental scholarships ranging from $500 to $2,500.

ProgramName: Master of Fine Arts in Dance
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Those who do not possess a bachelor's degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL: 80 (Internet-based), 550 (Paper-based); IELTS: 6.0; PTE: 53; Duolingo English Test: 105. CSULB will also accept the successful completion of ELS Language Centers' Level 112.
Description: The Master of Fine Arts (MFA) in Dance is a 60-unit graduate program that develops students’ creative and scholarly potential. We are committed to fostering artistic and academic excellence while encouraging students to investigate the intersections of choreography, performance, and scholarly inquiry. The MFA program is designed to develop and refine each student's artistic voice, pedagogical approach, and scholarly research. Coursework provides students with a breadth of experiences including choreography, dance production, improvisation, performance, pedagogy, research methods, somatics, and technique. Faculty within the CSULB Department of Dance have a wide-range of expertise. Areas of specialization include: contemporary dance practices, choreography, cultural studies, dance and technology, dance history/theory, improvisation, pedagogy, Pilates, somatics, and various world dance forms. Graduate students work in a stimulating environment with dedicated faculty and a diverse student population. Our graduates are prepared to teach dance in higher education and to pursue their careers as performing and creative artists.
Accredidation: The Department of Dance is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Dance (NASD).

ProgramName: Master of Music with option in Composition
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting one of the following: TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 (internet-based) or 550 (paper-based); IELTS with a minimum overall band score of 6.0; PTE with a minimum score of 53; or Duolingo English Test (DET) with a minimum score of 105.
Department: College of the Arts, Bob Cole Conservatory of Music
Description: The Master of Music (M.M.) degree is offered in seven options: Composition, Conducting (Choral, Instrumental-Wind, and Orchestral), Jazz Studies, Music Education, Opera Performance, Performance, and Piano Pedagogy. These options provide an opportunity for students to develop their creative and scholarly abilities and to gain a greater depth and breadth of knowledge and skills. The M.M. is designed to prepare students for a professional career in music and for further graduate study.
Accredidation: Accredited by the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).

ProgramName: Master of Music with option in Instrumental/Vocal Performance
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by taking one of the following tests and earning the required score: TOEFL 80 iBT, IELTS 6.0, PTE 53, or Duolingo English Test (DET) 110.
Description: The Master of Music degree is a professional degree for musicians who have attained a high level of skill in performance, conducting, composition, or scholarly inquiry. The Master of Music in Performance is designed for students who demonstrate the potential to achieve the highest levels of professional accomplishment in their field. Students work with our world-class faculty of performers and scholars and have numerous opportunities to perform as soloists and in a variety of large and small ensembles.

ProgramName: Master of Music with option in Instrumental/Choral Conducting
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by taking one of the following tests: TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 (Internet-based) or 550 (paper-based), IELTS with an overall band score of 6.0, PTE with a minimum score of 53, or Duolingo English Test (DET) with a minimum score of 105.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Master of Music degree program, the applicant must:
1. Hold a baccalaureate degree in music from an accredited institution, or the equivalent, with a GPA of 3.0 or better in upper-division music courses.
2. Demonstrate the potential for success in the chosen field in an audition and/or interview, and by the submission of all required application materials.
3. Students whose undergraduate preparation is deemed insufficient may be required to take remedial courses that will not be counted toward the master’s degree.

For the Instrumental/Choral Conducting option, the following must be uploaded to the Music Graduate Application Portal:
1. Current résumé or curriculum vitae, including a comprehensive list of repertoire studied and performed.
2. Statement of Purpose (approximately 500 words), addressing your purpose in pursuing graduate study in music, career goals, and why you believe the Bob Cole Conservatory of Music is a good place for you to study.
3. Three current letters of recommendation from persons qualified to evaluate your potential for graduate study in music.
4. A scholarly paper, preferably on a topic in music, that demonstrates the applicant’s ability to write cogently about music and to conduct research. The paper should be a minimum of five pages, double-spaced.
5. A pre-screening video of approximately 15-20 minutes of the applicant conducting both rehearsal and performance is required.
Department: College of the Arts, Bob Cole Conservatory of Music
Description: The Master of Music is a professional degree for students with a high level of specialization in one of the nine available options. Its objective is to develop in its students a mature and professional concept of music as a creative art and to provide the opportunity for them to develop a high level of competence and artistry in performance, conducting, composition, or music history; to provide them with the background necessary for study at the doctoral level; and to provide the necessary experience and qualifications for careers in music.
Accredidation: The Bob Cole Conservatory of Music is a fully-accredited member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).
CostPerCredit: $396 per unit for non-residents (in addition to other fees)

ProgramName: Master of Music with option in Opera
EnglishScore: All applicants, regardless of citizenship, who do not possess a bachelor's degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must demonstrate competence in English. Acceptable tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT 80 or PBT 550; IELTS 6.0; PTE 53; or Duolingo 105. Completion of ELS Level 112 is also accepted.
Requirements: In addition to the general requirements of the university, prospective Master of Music students must satisfy the following requirements for admission to the Bob Cole Conservatory of Music. Have a GPA of 3.0 or higher in all undergraduate upper-division coursework in music. 3. Complete the university application via Cal State Apply. 4. Complete the Bob Cole Conservatory of Music Supplemental Application which includes a prescreening audition, a curriculum vitae/résumé, a statement of purpose (250-500 words), a repertoire list, three letters of recommendation, and unofficial transcripts. 5. Perform a successful audition for the appropriate faculty in the declared area of specialization. 6. Demonstrate proficiency in music theory, aural skills, and music history, as determined by the Graduate Placement Examination administered by the Bob Cole Conservatory of Music.
Description: The Master of Music degree is designed to provide professional training in specialized areas of music and to prepare students for a variety of careers in music, including teaching at the college level, professional performance and composition, or continuing on to doctoral study. The graduate program in vocal performance is designed to develop artistry, pedagogical skill, and scholarship in preparation for careers in performance and teaching. Applied study is complemented by courses in vocal pedagogy, diction, opera literature, song literature, and choral literature. The Opera Institute provides a wide range of training opportunities for graduate and undergraduate vocal performance majors. Each year, it presents two mainstage productions with orchestra, evenings of opera scenes, and a touring outreach production.
Accredidation: The Bob Cole Conservatory of Music is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).
CostPerCredit: $396 per unit (for non-residents, in addition to base tuition)

ProgramName: Master of Music with option in Jazz Studies
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. This can be demonstrated by submitting a minimum score of 80 on the TOEFL iBT, 6.0 on the IELTS, 53 on the PTE, or 105 on the Duolingo English Test.

A bachelor’s degree with a major in music (or its equivalent) from an accredited institution is required. Two letters of recommendation from persons qualified to judge the academic and musical potential of the applicant are also required. Applicants will be required to audition and take the graduate placement examinations given by the Conservatory in music theory and music history. Students who do not pass the graduate placement examinations will be required to complete specific review courses with a grade of “B” or better prior to enrolling in graduate-level courses in music theory and music history. The minimum GPA required for admission is 3.0 in the last 60 semester units of undergraduate work and 3.0 in upper division major courses.
Department: College of the Arts, Bob Cole Conservatory of Music
Description: The Master of Music degree is a professional degree for the specialist in music. It is designed to provide students with the opportunity to develop their musical skills to the highest possible professional and artistic level and to acquire a sophisticated knowledge of the literature in their chosen field of specialization. The degree represents the attainment of a high level of musicianship as demonstrated by the ability to perform publicly or to produce musical works of high quality. It further attests to the acquisition of a broad knowledge of music theory, history, and literature. Options are offered in Composition, Conducting (Choral or Instrumental), Jazz Studies, Opera, Performance (Orchestral Instrument, Organ, Piano, or Voice), and Piano Pedagogy.
Accredidation: The Bob Cole Conservatory of Music is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).
ScholarshipAmount: Awards typically range from $250 to over $10,000

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Music Education
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English.

Prospective students in music education apply for admission to the Master of Arts degree program for the fall semester only. The application requires two parts:

To be considered for admission to the Master of Arts in Music, applicants must meet the following minimum requirements:

2. Submission of all required application materials as stipulated by the Bob Cole Conservatory of Music.
3. Successful completion of the Bob Cole Conservatory of Music Graduate Placement Examinations in Music History and Music Theory.
4. Successful completion of the appropriate entrance audition, interview, or submission of portfolio.
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit for non-residents. Resident tuition is a flat fee based on unit load, not per credit.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Musicology
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English.

For the Musicology (MA) option, applicants must submit the following via the Music GETAcceptd portal: A Statement of Purpose (500-600 words) describing your academic and research interests and your professional goals; A substantive example of your scholarly writing on a musical topic (e.g., a term paper from an upper-division music history course); Three current letters of recommendation from persons in a position to speak of your musical and academic abilities; A résumé or curriculum vitae that lists your educational background, professional experience, and scholarly/creative accomplishments; Unofficial transcripts from all previous colleges. A brief on-campus or virtual interview with the Musicology faculty will be scheduled after a preliminary review of your application materials.
Department: Bob Cole Conservatory of Music, College of the Arts
Description: The Master of Arts in Music degree is offered with a choice of options in Musicology or Music Education. Graduate students in both options complete a rigorous course of study in music theory and music history and must demonstrate reading knowledge of a language other than English. The degree culminates in a thesis or curriculum project and is completed with a final oral examination.
Accredidation: The Bob Cole Conservatory of Music is a fully accredited member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit for non-residents (in addition to base tuition)

ProgramName: Master of Fine Arts in Theatre Arts with option in Acting
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. This can be demonstrated by submitting a minimum score from one of the following tests: TOEFL (iBT) 80, IELTS 6.0, PTE 53, or Duolingo English Test (DET) 105.
Requirements: In order to apply for the MFA Acting Program at CSULB, prospective students must complete both the University application through Cal State Apply, and a departmental audition. To complete your application file, the following supplemental materials must be uploaded through Cal State Apply by the application deadline: A current résumé listing theatrical experience, Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to your qualifications, A Statement of Purpose of no more than three pages, double-spaced, A headshot, Unofficial transcripts from all colleges and universities attended. Admission to the MFA Acting Program is by audition only.
Description: The Master of Fine Arts (MFA) in Theatre Arts with an Option in Acting at California State University, Long Beach is a three-year, 60-unit, conservatory-style program focused on the development of the actor as a collaborative artist. The program’s mission is to rigorously train and educate students with a diversity of backgrounds and experiences to become professional actors, creative artists, and teachers of acting. The program is designed to discipline the actor’s instrument through the integration of voice, speech, and movement. Throughout their training, actors engage in a sequence of studio classes that foster the development of a unique, personal acting process that will form the basis of their continued growth as working artists. We encourage the application of classroom training to the creation of both new and established works. The program culminates with a public performance of a thesis role in a fully-mounted production. In their final semester, students produce a showcase of their work, which is presented in Los Angeles to an invited audience of industry professionals.
Accredidation: The Department of Theatre Arts at CSULB is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Theatre (NAST).
CostPerCredit: An additional $420 per unit for non-residents.

ProgramName: Master of Fine Arts in Theatre Arts with option in Theatre Management (MFA/MBA)
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting one of the following: TOEFL- 80 iBT, IELTS- 6.0 overall band score, PTE- 53, Duolingo English Test (DET)- 115, or Successful completion of ELS- Level 112.
Requirements: A current resume; A statement of purpose, 300-500 words, articulating your reasons for pursuing this degree; Two letters of recommendation from individuals able to comment on your academic and/or professional background; A written analytical essay, 1000-2000 words, that is a critical review of a theatrical performance you have recently seen or an essay that details your approach to producing one of the plays from this list: Fences, In The Heights, Next to Normal, Water by the Spoonful, or Sweat. The GRE will be waived for Fall 2024 graduate applicants.
Department: College of the Arts, College of Business
Description: The Department of Theatre Arts and the Graduate School of Business Administration jointly offer a three-year, 78-unit program leading to the concurrent Master of Fine Arts in Theatre Arts and the Master of Business Administration degrees. The program provides a unique opportunity for specialized training that prepares students for a variety of leadership positions in the dynamic and growing field of arts administration, particularly for management positions in not-for-profit and commercial regional theatres and performing arts centers. Applicants must apply to and be accepted by both the Department of Theatre Arts and the College of Business Administration. Two separate applications are required.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Japanese Language & Pedagogy
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting one of the following: TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 (Internet-based) or 550 (paper-based); IELTS with an overall band score of 6.0; PTE with a minimum score of 53; or Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105.
Requirements: Applicants must possess a bachelor’s degree with a major in Japanese, or its equivalent, from an accredited college or university, with a grade point average of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester (or 90 quarter) units attempted, and at least 3.0 in the major. Proficiency in Japanese equivalent to having completed all the requirements for the BA in Japanese at CSULB is also required. In addition to the university application, applicants must submit the following departmental application materials directly to the Asian and Asian American Studies Department (AAAS) Graduate Advisor: a Statement of Purpose (1-2 pages), a Writing Sample (10-15 pages in Japanese or English), three Letters of Recommendation, and an unofficial copy of transcripts.
Description: The Master of Arts degree in Japanese Language and Pedagogy is designed to provide students with a solid foundation in Japanese linguistics, and second language acquisition theory and practice, to prepare them for careers in Japanese language education at the secondary and post-secondary levels in the U.S. and other countries. The MA program provides students with opportunities to analyze and conduct research related to Japanese language pedagogy. Students interested in pursuing a doctoral degree in related fields can also gain strong preparation by completing this MA program.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Accountancy
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants, regardless of citizenship, who do not possess a bachelor's degree from a post-secondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (Internet-based) – 80, TOEFL (Paper-based) - 550, IELTS – 6.0, PTE – 53, or Duolingo – 105.
Description: The Master of Science in Accountancy (MSA) is a 30-unit cohort program designed to provide students with the technical knowledge, communication skills, and critical thinking abilities for a successful career in public or corporate accounting. The program is specifically intended for students who have completed an undergraduate degree with a major in accounting from an AACSB-accredited university. The program is full-time, finishing in 10 months from August to May.
Accredidation: The College of Business and its Accountancy programs are AACSB-accredited.
CostPerCredit: $270 per unit (Graduate Business Professional Fee) in addition to standard graduate tuition

ProgramName: Master of Science in Finance
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting a minimum score of 80 on the TOEFL iBT, 550 on the TOEFL PBT, 6.0 on the IELTS, 53 on the PTE, 105 on the Duolingo English Test, or by completing level 112 in the ELS Language Centers Program.
Description: The Master of Science in Finance (MSF) program at California State University, Long Beach (CSULB) provides a quantitative and comprehensive curriculum that offers in-depth exposure to the principles and practices of corporate finance, investments, and risk management. With its advanced curriculum, the program provides a unique combination of a strong foundation in finance principles and cutting-edge practical knowledge. Students gain hands-on experiences with financial databases (Bloomberg, Morningstar, etc.) and software (Crystal Ball, Python, etc.) from our world-class faculty. The program is specifically designed to prepare students for careers in the finance profession and for professional certifications, such as the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) and Certified Financial Planner (CFP) designations.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International - The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Information Systems
EnglishScore: International students are required to take the TOEFL and score a minimum of 80 (iBT) or the IELTS and score a minimum of 6.0.
Requirements: To be admitted in classified status, an applicant must have a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution with a major in business administration, computer science, or information systems; a minimum GPA of 3.0 in the last 60 semester units; and a GMAT score of 500 or higher (or a comparable GRE score). The GMAT/GRE requirement is waived for applicants with a GPA of 3.0 or better from a business program accredited by AACSB or from a domestic U.S. university. The waiver also applies to those with a degree in computer science or computer engineering from an ABET-accredited program, or those with 3+ years of professional full-time IT work experience in the U.S. Required documents to upload to the Cal State Apply application include unofficial transcripts, a Statement of Purpose, a resume, and a GMAT or GRE test score (if applicable).
Description: The Master of Science in Information Systems (MSIS) program is designed for students who want to become leaders at the intersection of information systems and management. The program’s mission is to educate business professionals to become leaders who can align information technology with business needs by applying best-practice management techniques and leveraging appropriate IT tools. The MSIS program integrates a core business curriculum with a set of courses that focus on key aspects of information systems. The coursework balances theoretical concepts and practical applications. The program is flexible to accommodate students with or without a technical background. The program has been classified as a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) program. The STEM designation allows eligible graduates on student visas access to an Optional Practical Training (OPT) extension, helping them to stay and work in the U.S. for up to three years after graduation.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International at both the undergraduate and graduate levels.
CostPerCredit: $750 per unit

ProgramName: Master of Science in Marketing Analytics
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. A minimum score of 80 on the TOEFL iBT, 550 on the TOEFL PBT, or 6.5 overall band score on the IELTS, or 53 on the PTE, or 105 on the Duolingo English Test.
Description: The Master of Science in Marketing Analytics (MSMA) is a one-year, 30-unit, cohort-based program that prepares students for marketing careers in our data-driven world. The MSMA is a STEM-designated program. This intensive program integrates marketing strategy, research, and data analytics to provide students with the advanced knowledge and skills necessary to succeed in a wide array of marketing careers. MSMA graduates will be able to: Analyze marketing data for strategic decision making; Understand and apply marketing research tools and techniques; Design, implement, and evaluate marketing strategies; Create effective data visualizations; Present and communicate complex information clearly and persuasively.
Accredidation: The College of Business, which offers this program, is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB).

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
EnglishScore: International students are required to take the TOEFL or IELTS exam unless they have a bachelor's degree from an accredited U.S. institution. Applicants must have a minimum TOEFL score of 80 (iBT), IELTS score of 6.0, PTE score of 53, or Duolingo score of 115.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, applicants must meet the following requirements: a bachelor's degree from a regionally-accredited university, a minimum GPA of 2.5 (cumulative or in the last 60 semester units), and submission of a Cal State Apply application with official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended. The following documents are required to be uploaded to the application: a current résumé, a statement of purpose, a video statement of purpose, and two letters of recommendation.
Description: The Master of Business Administration (MBA) is a general management program that emphasizes a case-based, team-oriented, and hands-on learning approach. Students have the opportunity to participate in a variety of high-impact activities, such as case competitions, consulting projects with real clients, and a two-week international study trip. Graduates of our programs become transformational leaders, making a difference in the public and private sectors both locally and internationally.
Accredidation: The CSULB College of Business is an AACSB International accredited school, a recognition achieved by only one-third of business schools in the U.S. and 15% worldwide.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration (MBA) Accelerated
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. This can be met by receiving a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (80 iBT), IELTS (6.0 overall band score), PTE (53), Duolingo (105), or completing ELS Level 112.
Requirements:
All applicants must complete the Cal State Apply online application and pay the non-refundable $70 application fee. The following materials are required to be submitted with the application:
- Current Resume (two page maximum)
- Statement of Purpose
- Video Statement of Purpose
- Two Letters of Recommendation: Applicants should provide contact information for their recommenders in Cal State Apply. The recommenders will then be sent a link to a standard recommendation form.
- Official Transcripts: One official transcript from each college or university attended is required.
- GMAT/GRE: The GMAT/GRE is currently waived for all MBA Programs for the Spring 2024 and Fall 2024 terms.
- International Applicants: International Applicants are required to take the TOEFL or IELTS exam unless they have a bachelor’s degree from a U.S. institution.
Fees: The estimated total tuition & fees for the 2-year Accelerated MBA program is approximately $45,000 for California residents and $69,000 for non-residents of California and international students.
Concentration: Finance, Human Resources Management, Management Information Systems, Marketing
Description: The Day/Time MBA is a 48-unit lock-step program designed to be completed in 21 months. It is the only MBA program at CSULB that is open to all majors including those without any business background. Students are admitted as a cohort and take all classes together, fostering a collaborative environment, team spirit, and a strong network. Students may choose one of four areas of specialization: Finance, Human Resources Management, Management Information Systems, or Marketing. GMAT/GRE may be waived. Please visit our GMAT/GRE Waiver Policy page for more details.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) at both the undergraduate and graduate levels.
CollegeApplicationFee: The estimated total tuition & fees for the 2-year Accelerated MBA program is approximately $45,000 for California residents and $69,000 for non-residents of California and international students.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration (MBA) Evening
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Those who do not possess a bachelor’s degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score of 80 (iBT) on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), 6.0 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), 53 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE), or 105 on the Duolingo English Test (DET).
Requirements: Specific requirements for admission to classified graduate status are: a bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution, or an equivalent degree from a non-U.S. institution; being in good academic standing at the last college or university attended; and a grade point average (GPA) of at least 2.75 on a 4.0 scale. A minimum of two years of full-time, professional work experience after completion of a bachelor's degree is preferred. Required application materials to be submitted include a completed Cal State Apply Application, a current résumé, a statement of purpose, a video statement of purpose, and official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
Concentration: Finance, Global Logistics & Supply Chain Management, Human Resources Management, Information Systems, Management, Marketing
Description: The Evening MBA Program is designed for working professionals who wish to pursue a graduate business degree on a part-time basis. Classes are offered Monday through Thursday evenings. The program provides an integrated perspective of business, with an emphasis on the global and technological environment. Coursework encompasses all business functions, including accounting, finance, human resources, information systems, law, management, marketing, and operations. The Evening MBA is a 48-unit program.
Accredidation: The College of Business is one of a select number of institutions to have earned dual accreditation from the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) for both its Business and Accounting programs.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration (MBA) Online
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting a satisfactory score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (minimum 80 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (minimum 6.0 overall band score), PTE Academic (minimum score of 53), or Duolingo English Test (minimum score of 105).
Requirements: A bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited university. GPA of at least 2.5 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units of coursework. At least two years of full-time, professional work experience. The Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) or Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is required. An approved GMAT/GRE waiver is available for highly qualified applicants. International applicants must submit a TOEFL score of at least 80 (iBT).
Description: The Online MBA program at CSULB is a 2-year cohort program that admits for the Fall semester only. The curriculum is specifically designed for working professionals to enhance their career opportunities. It is delivered in a fully online format and is an accelerated program with a structured schedule.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) at both the undergraduate and graduate levels.
ScholarshipType: Academic excellence, leadership, community service and financial need

ProgramName: Master of Science in Nursing
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Minimum scores required are: TOEFL iBT 80, IELTS 6.0 (overall band score), PTE 53, or Duolingo 105.
Concentration: ['Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner (AGACNP)', 'Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner (AGPCNP)', 'Family Nurse Practitioner (FNP)', 'Pediatric Primary Care Nurse Practitioner (PNP)', 'Psychiatric-Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP)', 'Nurse Educator (NE)', 'Nursing and Health Systems Executive Management (NHEM)']
Description: The Master of Science degree in Nursing is designed to prepare advanced practice nurses to function in a variety of health care settings. The curriculum is designed to provide a foundation for doctoral study. The graduate will be able to: Utilize theory and research in a specialized area of advanced nursing practice and in the analysis of health care issues; Demonstrate competence in a specialized role of advanced nursing practice; Participate in the planning, implementation, and evaluation of health care; Identify and analyze health care issues for the purpose of initiating and promoting change; Collaborate with other health care professionals and consumers in the planning and delivery of health care; Identify and pursue nursing research problems and utilize research findings; Promote the nursing profession through professional and community activities; Assume a leadership role in nursing and health care; Demonstrate a commitment to life-long learning to maintain competence in advanced nursing practice.
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master's degree program in nursing, and Doctor of Nursing Practice program at California State University Long Beach are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, 202-887-6791.

ProgramName: Doctor of Philosophy in Engineering and Computational Mathematics
EnglishScore: For international students, a minimum score on an approved English language proficiency test is required. The minimum score for the TOEFL is 80 (iBT) or 550 (PBT), and for the IELTS is 6.0.
Requirements:
A master's degree in engineering, computer science or a closely related discipline from a regionally accredited university with a minimum of 3.5 GPA on a 4.0 scale in the master’s program.
A bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science or a closely related discipline from a regionally accredited university with a minimum of 3.5 GPA on a 4.0 scale in the bachelor’s program.
The GRE is not required for admission to the Ph.D. program.
Description: The Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) in Engineering and Computational Mathematics is an interdisciplinary program jointly offered by the College of Engineering (COE) and the College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics (CNSM). This is an innovative, research-oriented doctoral program whose primary purpose is to educate the next generation of engineers, scientists, and mathematicians to use high-performance computing to solve complex, large-scale, and interdisciplinary problems of interest to society. Students graduating from this program will possess the advanced computational and mathematical skills needed to develop innovative solutions for aerospace, civil, and mechanical engineering systems, as well as in other related science and engineering fields. The Ph.D. in Engineering and Computational Mathematics is designed as a full-time program. The doctoral degree is awarded in recognition of a student’s demonstrated ability to make a significant and original contribution to research in engineering or applied science. Students will be required to develop a solid foundation in their chosen engineering discipline and mathematics, to pass a series of examinations, and to conduct a significant and original research investigation. The outcome of the research is to be presented in a written dissertation and defended in a final oral examination. Graduates of the program will be well prepared for a career in academia or industry.
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit (for non-residents)

ProgramName: Doctorate in Educational Leadership
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by receiving a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (iBT): 80, IELTS: 6.0, PTE: 53, or Duolingo: 105. This requirement applies unless the applicant possesses a bachelor’s degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction.
Requirements:
A master's degree from a regionally accredited institution.
A cumulative grade point average of at least 3.0 in all upper-division and graduate coursework.
A current resume or curriculum vitae that documents a minimum of three years of professional experience in an educational setting, including leadership responsibilities.
A statement of purpose (approximately 1,000 words).
Three letters of recommendation submitted through the Cal State Apply system. At least one letter must be from a professor, and at least one from a professional supervisor.
A sample of academic writing that demonstrates analytical and writing skills.
Applicants who satisfy the above requirements will be invited to an on-campus interview with the Ed.D. Admissions Committee.
CostPerCredit: $1,250 per unit

ProgramName: Doctorate in Educational Administration
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Acceptable tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT 80 (or PBT 550), IELTS 6.0, PTE 53, Duolingo 105, or completion of ELS Level 112.
Concentration: Pre-K-12 Educational Leadership, Community College/Higher Education Leadership, Social and Cultural Analysis of Education (SCAE)
Description: The Doctor of Education in Educational Leadership is a 60-unit program that is dedicated to developing the next generation of Pre-K-12 school, community college, and higher education administrators. The program is specifically designed to meet the needs of working professionals. All classes are offered in the evenings during the fall, spring, and summer semesters. The program of study is designed for students to complete their coursework in two years and the dissertation within three years. The Educational Leadership Ed.D. Program is a cohort-based program. Students are admitted each fall and progress through the program in a learning community. Students will engage in an applied dissertation of practice to address a current, relevant problem within their educational organizations.

ProgramName: Doctorate in Higher Education Administration
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting one of the following: TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 (Internet-based); IELTS with an overall band score of 6.0; PTE with a minimum score of 53; or Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105.
Requirements: A minimum graduate grade point average (GPA) of 3.5 on a 4.0 scale in all graduate coursework. A master’s degree from an accredited institution. Evidence of a strong academic background, particularly in research and writing, and potential for success in a doctoral program. A research interest related to the mission of the program. At least three years of full-time significant leadership experience. Current employment in a leadership position.
Description:
The Educational Leadership doctoral program at California State University, Long Beach is designed to prepare transformative leaders for the complex challenges and opportunities in P-12 schools and districts and in community colleges and higher education institutions.

The three-year, 60-unit program provides a unique opportunity for a cohort of students from P-12 and post-secondary education organizations to learn and work together on issues of mutual interest. The curriculum has a strong focus on social justice and equity, leadership, evidence-based decision making, and effective management of fiscal and human resources.

Students complete the program within a cohort model of approximately 20-25 students. Classes meet face-to-face on Saturdays, and online activities are also required. Two 8-week courses are taken each semester (fall, spring and summer) during the first two years of the program. During the third year, students focus on their dissertation research. Courses are taught by full-time faculty in the College of Education, and by experienced administrator-scholars.
CostPerCredit: $600 per unit
ScholarshipType: Doctoral Program Grant, Doctoral Program Scholarship

ProgramName: Certificate in Advanced Paralegal
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting one of the following: TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 (iBT), IELTS with a minimum overall band score of 6.0, PTE with a minimum score of 53, or Duolingo English Test (DET) with a minimum score of 105. Successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112 is also accepted.
Department: College of Professional and Continuing Education
Description: The Certificate in Advanced Paralegal is a 30-unit program that provides students with a comprehensive education in practical paralegal skills. Students receive instruction in the latest computer technology including online legal research. Substantive law courses are taught by members of the judiciary and practicing attorneys. The program is designed to meet the needs of working adults. All courses are held on Saturdays at the CSULB campus. Courses are completed in a prescribed sequence during a 14-month period. For more information, visit the Certificate in Advanced Paralegal website.
ScholarshipType: Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA), MyCAA for Military Spouses, Private Loans, Employer Vouchers, GI Bill

ProgramName: Certificate in Agile Project Management
Department: College of Professional and Continuing Education
Description:
The Certificate in Agile Project Management is designed for project managers, product owners, Scrum masters, and other professionals who seek to deliver business value through the adoption of Agile methodologies. Participants will gain the knowledge and skills needed to effectively lead Agile teams, manage Agile projects, and support organizational change toward a more flexible and adaptive approach.

In this program, you will gain an understanding of the concepts and techniques of Agile as an approach to project management. You will discover the different approaches within Agile, focusing on the ones that are most popular, like Scrum, Kanban, Lean, and extreme programming (XP). You will also gain an understanding of how to lead and motivate Agile teams by gaining insights into self-organization, team empowerment, and servant leadership.

ProgramName: Certificate in Applied Analytics and Machine Learning for Higher Education
Fees: $7,248 for the entire 12-unit program for California residents (based on 2024-2025 rates). Non-resident tuition is an additional $420 per unit.
Description: The Certificate in Applied Analytics and Machine Learning for Higher Education provides higher education professionals, institutional researchers and other professionals with advanced training in data analytics and machine learning. This program equips students with the knowledge and skills needed to understand and implement machine learning algorithms and computational techniques to solve a variety of problems in institutional research, strategic planning, and enrollment management.

ProgramName: Certificate in Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA)
Requirements: High school diploma or GED equivalent; Proficiency in English (reading, writing, and speaking).
Department: College of Professional and Continuing Education (CPACE)
Description:
The Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) program at CSULB is an intensive 18-day program that prepares students to provide basic nursing care in a variety of healthcare settings. This non-credit program is an excellent starting point for those interested in pursuing a career in nursing or other healthcare fields.

Students will receive 72 hours of classroom instruction and 128 hours of clinical experience, which provides hands-on training in a skilled nursing facility. The curriculum includes training in patient rights, communication, safety, observation, reporting, and assisting residents with daily living activities. Students will also learn how to take and record vital signs, as well as how to provide personal care such as bathing, dressing, and feeding.

Upon completion of the program, students will be eligible to take the California Nurse Assistant Competency Examination to become a Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA). This program fulfills the requirements of the California Department of Public Health for CNA training. Please note that employment as a CNA requires a criminal background check.
Accredidation: This program fulfills the requirements of the California Department of Public Health for CNA training.
ScholarshipType: Workforce Innovation & Opportunity Act (WIOA), MyCAA, Employer Funding / Tuition Assistance, Private Education Loans

ProgramName: Certificate in Clinical Medical Assistant
Term: New sessions start every six weeks
Department: College of Professional and International Education
Description: The Clinical Medical Assistant program at CSULB is one of the premier medical assistant programs in Southern California. Offered in partnership with nationally recognized Condensed Curriculum International (CCI), this course will prepare you to work as a professional in multiple healthcare settings. Medical assistants with a clinical background can perform various clinical tasks including assisting with the administration of medications, minor procedures, performing an EKG, obtaining laboratory specimens for testing, educating patients, and other related tasks. This program also includes an optional clinical externship at a local healthcare provider, which will provide you with 160 hours of hands-on experience.
ScholarshipType: Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA), MyCAA (Military Spouse Career Advancement Accounts)

ProgramName: Certificate in Collections Management for Costume and Textiles
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Certificate in Collections Management for Costume and Textiles is designed to provide students with the knowledge and practical experience necessary to manage, preserve, and interpret costume and textile collections. The certificate is a valuable asset to those interested in working in museums, historical societies, and other cultural institutions with costume and textile collections. It is also beneficial to those who wish to work as private collection managers or consultants. The curriculum combines the theoretical and practical aspects of collection management.

ProgramName: Certificate in Crime and Intelligence Analysis Program
Requirements: A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution is required for admission. Students may complete the certificate concurrently with their undergraduate degree program as long as they hold senior standing.
Department: College of Professional and Continuing Education
Description: Crime analysis is a law enforcement function that involves systematic analysis for identifying and analyzing patterns and trends in crime and disorder. Information on patterns can help law enforcement agencies deploy resources in a more effective manner, and assist detectives in identifying and apprehending suspects. Crime analysis also plays a role in devising solutions to crime problems, and developing crime prevention strategies. The Certificate in Crime and Intelligence Analysis is a two-semester program designed to provide a comprehensive introduction to the theory and practice of crime and intelligence analysis. The program is taught by faculty who are specialists in crime analysis, as well as experienced practitioners in the field.

ProgramName: Certificate in Digital Marketing
Department: College of Professional and Continuing Education
Description: As the digital world continues to expand and grow, it is becoming increasingly important for companies to meet consumers where they are. In this program, you will develop the digital marketing skills needed for a variety of roles in the industry. Learn how to create and implement an effective digital marketing strategy, leveraging social media platforms, SEO tactics, and digital advertising. Discover how to track campaign results through web and social media analytics in order to calculate ROI and drive business growth. This program is offered in partnership with GreenFig, a leading industry-driven education company. No previous experience is required to enroll.

ProgramName: Certificate in Geographic Information Science
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. This can be demonstrated by submitting a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (80 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE (53), Duolingo English Test (105), or completion of ELS Level 112.
Description: The Certificate in Geographic Information Science (GIScience) is a 16-unit program for individuals who wish to acquire GIScience knowledge and skills for their profession. The certificate is especially useful for individuals with a degree in Geography or a related field (e.g. Environmental Science and Policy, Geology, Anthropology, Engineering, Urban Planning, etc.) who are returning to the university for specialized training in GIScience. The program offers a solid theoretical background in GIScience as well as advanced technical skills that are attractive to employers in both the public and private sectors. The certificate is offered completely face-to-face, so that we can offer students hands-on mentoring opportunities.
